a.title: Legend for this format

description.value: Subject of care Maturity Level: 0 Draft

name.value: Idea4RC Subject model to FHIR R4 Map

definition.value: Subject of care Maturity Level: 0 Draft
Date of the procedure from which the specimen was obtained that allowed the histological diagnosis.

comment.value: Must be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. Leave empty if not known. Optional rule : Possible date anonymisation by setting the 15th of every month i.e.: YYYY-MM-15. If the month is not known, we set it to June (06).

definition.value: Age of the patient at the time of the diagnosis. required if date of diagnosis known

comment.value: An integer value > 0. We use the -1 value for unknown. Automatic calculation from date of birth and date of diagnosis.

definition.value: Histology of prymary tumour according to WHO 2017 clasification.

comment.value: A value in the WHO 2017 H&N classification list.

definition.value: Specifies the histological subgroup

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized

definition.value:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

requirements.value: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored. This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

isModifierReason.value: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

short.value: Nasal cavity and paranasal sinuses subsite

definition.value: Specifies the subsite for cancers occurred in nasal cavity and paranasal sinusess

comment.value: A string value in the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual 8th subsite list

definition.value: Specifies the subsite for cancers occurred in nasopharynx

comment.value: A string value in the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual 8th subsite list

definition.value: Specifies the subsite for cancers occurred in hypopharynx

comment.value: A string value in the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual 8th subsite list

definition.value: Specifies the subsite for cancers occurred in oropharynx

comment.value: A string value in the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual 8th subsite list

definition.value: Specifies the subsite for cancers occurred in larynx

comment.value: A string value in the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual 8th subsite list

definition.value: Specifies the subsite for cancers occurred in oral cavity

comment.value: A string value in the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual 8th subsite list

definition.value: Specifies the subsite for cancers occurred in lip

comment.value: A string value in the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual 8th subsite list

definition.value: Describes the result of EBV DNA plasma testing before treatment in NPC type II and III (WHO)

comment.value: A string value representing whether the test value was positive, negative or it was untested. Empty if unknown.

definition.value: Describes the primer used for EBV DNA plasma testing t in NPC type II and Type III (WHO)

comment.value: A string value representing the plasma testing type. Empty if unknown

definition.value: Copy number of EBVDNA

comment.value: An integer for the number of EBVDNA. Empty if unknown

definition.value: Describes the result of HPV tumor testing in oral carcinoma

comment.value: A string value representing whether the result was positive, negative or not tested. Empty if unknown.

definition.value: Describes the technique used for HPV tumour testing in orall carcinoma

comment.value: A string value representing which was the used technique. Empty if unknown.

definition.value: Describes the result of p16 tumour testing in oral carcinoma

comment.value: A string value representing whether the result was positive, negative or not tested. Empty if unknown.

definition.value: Describes the result of PDL tumour testing in oral carcinoma

comment.value: A string value representing whether the result was positive, negative or not tested. Empty if unknown.

definition.value: Describes the technique used for PDL tumour testing in oral carcinoma

comment.value: A string value representing which was the used technique. Empty if unknown.

definition.value: Result of PDL1CPS testing, when performed

comment.value: An integer for the PDL1CPS test. Empty if unknown.

definition.value: Result of PDL1TPS testing, when performed

comment.value: An integer for the PDL1TPS test. Empty if unknown.

definition.value: Describes the result of C reactive protein testing

comment.value: A string value representing whether the result was positive, negative or not tested. Empty if unknown.

definition.value: Result of CRP testing, when performed

comment.value: An integer for the CRP test. Empty if unknown.

definition.value: Describe if the instument is fully compiled or not

comment.value: A boolean for the instrument if it was fully compiled or not.
